Class Player

java.lang.Object
  Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

The class used to hold certain values, such as number of resources, which should be specific to one player and not in a shared pool.

Version:
Alpha 2.0
Author:
Alston Lin, James Ly
See Also:

Constructor Detail

Player

public Player()
The constructor for a player to keep track of wood, food, gold number of Units and Buildings. This constructor will give a default value of 200 of everything

Method Detail

changeFood

public void changeFood(int change)
Changes the value of food by the given amount. The value of food should be checked beforehand to ensure that the value will not go below 0.

Parameters:
change - The change in wood
